comments: Nice professor. Focus on the textbook.

my least favorite class to date. professors relied entirely too heavily on the book and used lecture as more of a summary/clarification of general points in the book. Ashworth was too softspoken and talked too fast, sometimes it seemed like she didn\'t know the material. tests sucked, read the book. extra credit offered in lecture.

This class relies heavily on the book. If you don\'t read the book, it\'s your own fault. Quizzes and tests are not terribly difficult, but they are not easy either. Dr. Ashworth does read from her slides, but if you read the material beforehand, you will know what\'s going on. She is very nice, and is concerned about her students.

Horrible teacher. One of the worst teachers I have had. She reads off the slides; she doesn\'t even teach. it\'s a tragedy for students who actually want to learn. She is sweet, but that doesn\'t hold up in a college course.

No other way to describe than horrible. She lets other professors teach 90% of the class. She reads off slides and goes way to fast for the lectures she does do. Quizzes have some questions with tiny details from the book or lecture with very little importance... One word describes this class, "Random"

Covered topics already covered in basic biology (Treated us like we had the intelligence of high school students). When she lectured she just read verbatim off of slides. Probably a nice lady, but has no idea how to teach.

I would not recommend this Prof, she is unorganized and will take several weeks to grade exams. Overall, the class is somewhat challenging. Lectures are mostly taught by other prof. in the bio/biochem department. Exams and quizzes are not that bad and do not reflect the in-depth detail of the lecture/textbook material which is nice.
Can\'t project her voice, goes way too fast, and doesn\'t teach things clearly. She sounds like she\'s reading out a of a text book when she lectures.
